intro: Rubus menkei var. argutifrons, commonly known as the serrated blackberry, is a variant of the blackberry plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Rubus genus.
